The ritual, intended for good luck, resulted in the car plummeting 15 feet, causing significant damage. Miraculously, the woman sustained only minor injuries, and authorities are currently investigating the incident.

Canada rejects 80% of Indian student visas in 2025, Germany rises as top destination
description: In 2025, Canada implemented its most restrictive student visa regime in a decade, rejecting nearly 80% of Indian applications and tightening financial and language requirements. This has caused a sharp decline in Indian enrolments, forcing students to consider alternatives like Germany, which now leads in popularity. The shift signals a global recalibration in international student mobility and education trends.

USCIS makes an example out of Indian-origin Rambhai Patel, sentenced for visa fraud
description: Rambhai Patel, an Indian-origin man, received a 20-month jail sentence for orchestrating a visa fraud scheme involving staged armed robberies. Patel and his co-conspirator, Balwinder Singh, fabricated robberies at stores and restaurants to enable employees to fraudulently claim U visas. Patel will forfeit $850,000 and face deportation to India after serving his sentence.

title: Rape accused flees from custody: Bulandshahr villagers block cops
description: A rape accused, Mohd Afzal, escaped police custody in Bulandshahr after villagers, including gram pradhan Mohd Rouf, allegedly intervened. An FIR has been filed against Rouf and 30 villagers for aiding Afzal's escape. Police are investigating the incident, including claims that villagers blocked roads to hinder the police.

title: 'I don't see any British people': Traveller questions why 'every worker' is Indian
Decomposing body found in Tesla owned by singer D4vd, car was abandoned in Los Angeles
description: A decomposing body was discovered in a Tesla registered to singer D4vd, found abandoned at a Los Angeles tow yard. Police discovered the remains in a bag inside the front trunk of the vehicle, which had been left at the yard for approximately five days. D4vd is scheduled to perform in Minneapolis on Tuesday as part of his "Withered" world tour that began last month.

title: 'I am still in shock': British Airways passenger claims woman urinated in seat
description: A British Airways passenger on a Boston to London flight endured a horrifying experience when a co-passenger allegedly urinated in her seat and remained there for the entire six-hour journey. The Redditor, who shared photos of the wet seat and the woman's bare feet intruding on others' space, expressed shock and concern for the next passenger.

title: Ericsson job cuts in Canada: Around 100 employees impacted; staff notified
description: Swedish telecom giant Ericsson is cutting around 100 technical jobs in Canada, according to reports. The move, announced on September 8th with an effective date of October 31st, is part of a global streamlining effort. Ericsson aims to align its Canadian network management services with worldwide operations, utilizing common tools and processes.

title: Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
description: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: ‘Phillies Karen’ identified, fired after taking Bader HR ball from kid
description: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: Megan Thee Stallion vs Adin Ross: Rapper sues streamer; what we know
description: Rapper Megan Thee Stallion has sued streamer Adin Ross. The lawsuit is regarding Ross's comments on the Tory Lanez shooting incident. Stallion's legal team accuses Ross of spreading misinformation. Ross confirmed he was served legal papers in an unusual way. A mariachi band appeared at his home to deliver the deposition.
